disp_name.description:
Name of the ability
Only necessary if the value differs from Corrosive Charge.

effect radius.value: 210

blurb.value: Fires an explosive charge at the target location, dealing physical damage and slowing enemies caught in the explosion.

description.value: Active: Urgot launches a canister at the target location that explodes 0.3 seconds after it lands, dealing physical damage and slowing all enemies hit for 1.25 seconds.

targeting.description: Permafrost is a single target ability.

affects.description: Permafrost affects enemy champions and large monsters

onhiteffects.description: onhiteffects can be set to 'true', for abilities that apply on-hit effects (from items or other abilities)

occurrence.description: occurrence can either be set to 'hit' or 'attack', and refers to on-hit effects

spellshield.description: spellshield can either be set to true, or written with a custom description.

callforhelp.description: callforhelp determines whether minion aggro will transfer to the caster

additional.description: Displays additional information in a smaller window below the template.

notes.value: * Corrosive Charge prevents Purge from firing for 0.3 seconds.
notes.description: Displays additional information with effect table to the right.

disp_name.description:
Name of the ability
Only necessary if the value differs from Purge.

effect radius.value: 490

blurb.value: Urgot shields himself, slowing himself while he unloads his weapon on nearby enemies. Prioritizes enemy champions Urgot has recently struck with other abilities and triggers Echoing Flames.

description.value: Passive: Urgot's other abilities apply Purge to enemy champions for 5 seconds. Only one enemy champion can be marked at a time.

description2.value: Active: For 4 seconds, Urgot grants ghosting to non-champions and non-epic monsters around him and autonomously attacks the nearest enemy at a fixed  3.0 attack speed, prioritizing enemy champions marked with Purge, refreshing it with every attack. Urgot can attack while moving, but while firing, his base movement speed is reduced by 125 and he gains 40% slow resist. Purge can be recast after 0.5 seconds.

description3.value: Attacks with Purge deal modified damage, with a minimum threshold of 50 against minions. On-hit damage is only 50% and the attacks cannot critically strike.

description5.value: At maximum rank, Purge lasts indefinitely and becomes a toggled ability.

targeting.description: Permafrost is a single target ability.

affects.description: Permafrost affects enemy champions and large monsters

onhiteffects.description: onhiteffects can be set to 'true', for abilities that apply on-hit effects (from items or other abilities)

occurrence.description: occurrence can either be set to 'hit' or 'attack', and refers to on-hit effects

spellshield.description: spellshield can either be set to true, or written with a custom description.

callforhelp.description: callforhelp determines whether minion aggro will transfer to the caster

additional.description: Displays additional information in a smaller window below the template.

notes.value: * Purge uses edge range for enemy targets only; Its range is center-to-edge. Urgot's size increasing does not increase its range. The initial cast and the manual recast count as ability activations for the purposes of on-cast effects such as Spellblade, charging Spellbinder, and stacking Force Pulse. Before maximum rank, if Purge is not manually recasted, the effect will end without being considered as an ability activation. Before maximum rank, if continuously attacking without being interrupted or interrupting or canceling the cast, Urgot will shoot 13 attacks. The bolts are considered basic attacks and thus apply  life steal at full efficiency. During Purge, Urgot's  attack range is reduced by 200 and his attack commands instead issue movement commands to walk into the respective range of his target. Slow resist does not modify flat reductions in movement speed. Percentage slows apply after the flat movement reduction. Purge's attacks do not interact with Urgot's basic attack timer. After ending Purge, he can usually attack again immediately. Purge does not fire while Urgot is unable to declare basic attacks (e.g. crowd control, cast time). Purge will fire while Urgot is dashing (e.g. while taking Thresh's Dark Passage), with the exception of Disdain's dash. Purge will apply Runaan's Hurricane on every shot at 100% of the listed damage. On-hit effects applied by the bolts will deal 50% damage regardless. The movement speed stat tooltip erroneously reads that the bonus movement speed is being reduced before base movement speed.*
notes.description: Displays additional information with effect table to the right.

disp_name.description:
Name of the ability
Only necessary if the value differs from Disdain.

target range.value: 450

blurb.value: Urgot charges in a direction, trampling non-champion enemies. If he catches an enemy champion, he will stop and hurl them out of his way.

description.value: Active: Urgot shields himself for 4 seconds.

leveling.value: Shield Strength:60 / 80 / 100 / 120 / 140 (+ 150% bonus AD) (+ 15% bonus health)

description2.value: After the cast time, Urgot dashes in the target direction, though not through terrain, dealing physical damage to all enemies in the way and knocking them aside.

description3.value: Urgot comes to a stop upon colliding with an enemy champion, stunning them for 1.5 seconds and, after 0.25 seconds, also flinging them to the location 100 units behind him over 0.5 seconds.

targeting.description: Permafrost is a single target ability.

affects.description: Permafrost affects enemy champions and large monsters

onhiteffects.description: onhiteffects can be set to 'true', for abilities that apply on-hit effects (from items or other abilities)

occurrence.description: occurrence can either be set to 'hit' or 'attack', and refers to on-hit effects

spellshield.description: spellshield can either be set to true, or written with a custom description.

callforhelp.description: callforhelp determines whether minion aggro will transfer to the caster

additional.description: Displays additional information in a smaller window below the template.

notes.value: * Urgot turns around when tossing an enemy over him, always facing his victim. Disdain prevents Purge from firing for 1.25 seconds. The range indicator length is 475 units, but the dash only moves Urgot 450 units. Disdain will cast from wherever Urgot is at the end of the cast time. The shield is granted at the start of the cast time while the dash begins after.
notes.description: Displays additional information with effect table to the right.

disp_name.description:
Name of the ability
Only necessary if the value differs from Fear Beyond Death.

target range.value: 2500

effect radius.value: Global / 600

width.value: 160

blurb.value: Urgot fires a chem-drill that impales the first enemy champion hit. If that champion falls below a health threshold, Urgot judges them weak and can execute them.

description.value: Active: Urgot fires a chem-drill in the target direction that impales the first enemy champion struck, dealing physical damage and leashing them for 4 seconds, during which they're revealed and slowed by 0% − 75% (based on target's missing health).

description2.value: Fear Beyond Death can be reactivated if the target is below  25% of their maximum health, and automatically does so if the target would be killed by the damage from the chem-drill, the ability is cast again while the target was above the threshold and is then brought within it, or the target is within the threshold at the end of its duration.

description3.value: Recast: Urgot launches chains at the target, then starts channeling once they latch on, suppressing them, revealing them, and pushing them up to 1000 units away based on Urgot's proximity to them, after which they're reeled in over 1.5 seconds, during which they are untargetable and invulnerable to damage from other sources. This channel cannot be interrupted by crowd control.

description4.value: If the channel is successful, the target is executed and surrounding enemies are feared for 1.5 seconds, slowing them by 75%.

description5.value: Fear Beyond Death's recast can be used while affected by crowd control.

targeting.description: Permafrost is a single target ability.

affects.description: Permafrost affects enemy champions and large monsters

damagetype.value: Physical / True

onhiteffects.description: onhiteffects can be set to 'true', for abilities that apply on-hit effects (from items or other abilities)

occurrence.description: occurrence can either be set to 'hit' or 'attack', and refers to on-hit effects

spellshield.description: spellshield can either be set to true, or written with a custom description.

callforhelp.description: callforhelp determines whether minion aggro will transfer to the caster

additional.description: Displays additional information in a smaller window below the template.

notes.value: * Unlike most missiles, Fear Beyond Death can hit the edge of targets whose center is further than the missile range. However, it still cannot hit targets whose center is behind Urgot. Applies spell damage on first cast and raw damage on recast. The circular execution indicator is visible to Urgot only and appears on all enemy champions below the threshold if the ability is not on cooldown. The recast's name is Mercy. Mercy's granted untargetability does not destroy in-flight projectiles for the target. Urgot will place himself onto the ground and interrupts displacements affecting him upon starting the channel. If the displacement effect is a knock up with no debuff source, the airborne status is not removed and he spends significantly less time in the air. Fear Beyond Death is always cast from the original casting position. Fear Beyond Death prevents Purge from firing for 0.8 seconds. The recast prevents Purge from firing for 1.5 seconds. If Urgot is in cast time or is dashing while the chains are in transit, Mercy's channel will be deferred (the debuff will continuously refresh) until the cast or dash is complete. The suppression and untargetability are imposed but the forced movement does not begin in this case. If Urgot is channeling a spell, the channel is interrupted when the chains hit. The initial cast always counts as an ability activation for the purposes of on-cast effects such as Spellblade, charging Spellbinder, and stacking Force Pulse. If the ability hits a target who is below the threshold, it will automatically recast itself and it won't be considered as an ability activation. If the ability hits a target who is above the threshold and it's recasted early, the recast will happen automatically when they reach the threshold and it won't be considered as as ability activation. If the target got hit while above the threshold and it is recasted after they fall below it, the recast will be considered as an ability activation. Reactivating the ability early will reel the target as soon as they reach the 25% maximum health threshold. The ability will reactivate and execute regardless of Urgot being affected by crowd control or not, including self or enemy-imposed stasis. There is a brief delay before the forced movement and untargetability begins. Urgot cannot send out the chains if the target is untargetable. The recast cannot be used (both manually and automatically) while Urgot is in resurrection, attempting to manually do so puts it on a 5-second  cooldown. If the target is below the threshold at the end of the duration and Urgot is revived, the recast will initiate regardless of the cooldown. The recast's chains are classified as a projectile and they will fail to affect their target if: Urgot or his target dies (including if Urgot enters resurrection). The target becomes untargetable, even if the granted source does not destroy in-flight projectiles. They collide with Wind Wall or Unbreakable. If the target is Braum and his Unbreakable is active, the chains will only apply the forced movement to him. He will not be executed. Braum will be pushed by the chains if he is not the target. The target is crowd control immune when the chains hit. Spell shield will not block the recast's chains. Removing the suppression (e.g. by cleanses or Urgot's death) during the reel-in will prevent the execute and stop the forced movement from being renewed, but the most recent one will still be present and move the victim to Urgot's previous location. The granted untargetability and invulnerability is also lost in the process. Displacement immunity, while preventing being dragged, does not remove the suppression, which can last for longer than the usual execution time. Once the target inevitably loses their displacement immunity, they are executed within 1.5 seconds. The target is untargetable and invulnerable for the whole duration of the suppression, even while displacement immune. When the chains start reeling in and suppressing a player's champion, chains will also cover the sides of their screen. The target champion shrinks in size in several steps after reaching Urgot's grinder and before being executed. If the suppression ends in any way, the target returns to their normal size. If the execution is successful, the victim's corpse will be effectively invisible unless they enter a zombie state. The target will die regardless of their current health once the recast's chains hit, even if they are healed. If the target has invulnerability (excluding the one granted by Fear Beyond Death, which prevents damage from all other sources, not the execution) that persists the duration of the channel, it will protect them from the execution. Undying Rage will prevent Tryndamere from dying by the execute. The execute will bypass his minimum health threshold though and reduce him to 1 health in this case. The effect will also not prevent the activation of resurrection effects, such as Guardian Angel or Anivia's Rebirth. Post-death events such as Zombie State effects (e.g, Karthus' Death Defied, Kog'Maw's Icathian Surprise, and Sion's Glory in Death) will be triggered. Only the target's current health will count as Urgot's damage in post-game statistics and  spell vamp healing. Fear Beyond Death's initial cast will not perform the automatic recast from dealing enough damage to kill Sion. The following table refers for interactions while Urgot is channeling: Type Channel Attacking Disabled Abilities Disabled Movement Allowed Items Usable Shurelya's Reverie Righteous Glory Youmuu's Ghostblade Spellbinder Gargoyle Stoneplate Randuin's Omen Seraph's Embrace Disabled All the other item-actives are disabled Interrupted by N/A Consumables Usable Spells Usable Barrier Clarity Cleanse Exhaust Ghost Heal Ignite Smite Flash Disabled Teleport Interrupted by N/A Interrupted by Death
